file_content.text: I hope you know what you're doing. Good luck.
I beg you--go to the mine. If the Empire takes it, the workers are as good as dead.
My men owe you their lives. We won't forget this.
Thanks to you, we can get our operation running again.
What will you do if they attack the pipeline again?
What if the Empire returns?
We'll build turrets near the pipeline. If the Empire tries anything else, they'll regret it.
It was nothing.
We've got production quotas to meet, and the Empire's not making that any easier.
If we're done here, then I want to get out of this poisonous swamp and back to somewhere less... fragrant.
I hope that was everything.
Can't blame you.
Hang on--a call's coming in from General Korvan.
I was hoping I'd reach you. Is the pipeline secure?
Things seem to be under control here for the moment, General.
It appears to be.
Excellent work, Master Jedi! The Republic is in your debt.
Havoc Squad forced the enemy back, and the breached pipe was repaired, General.
The pipeline is secure, sir.
I suspected you would have the situation in hand, Captain. Well done!
Don't worry, General, I took care of everything.
Things look good for now.
It seems your reputation is well-deserved.
You wouldn't have called just for a report. Has something gone wrong?
What's going on now?
On the contrary, we've gotten a stroke of unexpected luck.
Barely got it done.
The Empire is responding to their defeat here by making a frontal assault on our mining operation.
In so doing, they are using forces from their base defenses. This gives us an attack opportunity.
So this is our chance to hit the Imperial base while it's vulnerable?
You want to attack the base?
You can't take the troops out of the venom mine! What will happen to my people?
Major Treeg's division is still stationed at the mine. They are under heavy fire, but they're holding.
Do you have the manpower to defend the mines from a full-on assault?
Can we hold the mines?
Major Treeg's men are being pushed to their limits, but they are holding on for now.
With all respect, General, you can't leave Treeg's men alone at the mine! My people will be massacred!
What kind of opportunity?
We may never get another chance like this. It's dangerous, but we must strike at the Empire while we can.
Going after the Imperial base may cost our miners their lives, but gain us a strategic victory.
We can't sacrifice our mine for a chance at vengeance.
I won't abandon our miners.
Thank you. Those men have served the Republic well. They deserve protection.
The Empire's counting on our sentimental dedication to the miners. We must show our resolve.
Forget the mine. We attack.
Once you're finished, report to the Three Families' war camp. It's time you met our allies. Korvan out.
